subject: RE: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: Nope.  setUp() and tearDown() are useful only some of the time. ________________________________ From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
messageBody:
Nope. setUp() and tearDown() are useful only some of the time.


________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf Of alpanhell
Sent: Thursday, May 26, 2005 9:22 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown


Hello,

I've just started using junit and I have a question about usage.

I'm a bit concerned that I'm not understanding something that
seems
pretty integral to the design of junit. setUp() and tearDown()
are
called before and after every test, yet in all my TestCase's I'm
creating I'm finding no place where I need the same setup and
teardown
before every test within that TestCase. I can't think of very
many
scenarios where this would be useful, yet I'm finding tons of
places
where I need a one time setup and teardown for the whole
TestCase.

Am I missing something here?

thanks!

allen
